text: Decorated in Carol Brady chic. When it's not gaudy, tacky and loud, it's blander than toast. Colors like lime green and sunshine orange should be reserved for popsicles only MRS. BRUCE, late 30's, enters looking exhausted. She carr a glass of wine in one hand and a book in the other, Erma Bombeck's The Grass Is Always Greener Over The Septic Tan HUMMING "We've Only Just Begun," Mrs. Bruce crouches next her wildly-ancient entertainment center complete with 8-t She flips the first record forward on her Ronco Record Ma Album after album flaps forward. Olivia Newton-John, Neil Diamond, the Osmond Brothers. She stops on the Carpenters and sighs at the serene cover art. Just what the doctor  ordered. Placing the vinyl on the turntable, she CLICKS the dustco closed and FLICKS "Play." Reclining in her Lazyboy, she s her wine, opens the book and awaits the mellow tones of K Carpenter. Suddenly, her eardrums are hammered by machine gun GUITAR Caustic ROCK 'N' ROLL assaults her senses. She jumps, spi her wine all over herself. This isn't the Carpenters...

Racing to the entertainment center, she turns the volume  control knob so violently, it comes off in her hand. The  music is even louder now. Flustered by the awful noise, she tries lifting the dustc It's stuck. She screams and covers her ears. This is Hell Running to the rear of the huge console, she stretches to reach the plug, but can't. Fingertips millimeters away. As the cacophony POUNDS she shakes the entire stereo with all her frantic might. SCREEEEEECH! The needle scrapes across the vinyl with a  shrill, finally coming to a stop. Whew, silence! Then, POP, the dustcover opens unceremoniously. Shaken, s grabs the record with trembling hands and reads the label
Mrs. Bruce's blood boils.
KISS! The devil's music!

A small, two-story house amid a suburban neighborhood of  other two-story houses. Uninspired architecture. Spindly  trees.  Two-car garage. A faint yellow glow emanates from a cellar window across  which shadows frantically dart. Over the CRICKETS, we hea

head_text.subj: MUFFLED, BADLY-RENDERED ROCK 'N' ROLL. SCRATCHY, GUTTURAL

text: inhuman. CAMERA MOVES to the cellar window. Inside we see four TEE BOYS who are to blame for the racket. Band practice.

An inner-sanctum of KISS devotion. Faux-wood paneling is  plastered with countless KISS posters, pictures, fold-out The ceiling is wallpapered with more KISS posters. KISS d magazines, records, comic books clutter the shag-carpeted floor. Fast food wrappers heap over the KISS garbage pail The four high schoolers rock their hearts out as they bla a familiar tune offensively off-key.
"I wanna rock 'n' roll all night and  party every day!"

They stink, but they sure are trying hard. Meet the band  "Mystery." Concert tee-shirts, holey jeans, total burn-ou HAWK, a scraggily-haired, disenchanted youth, strains his vocal chords on the microphone as he SCRATCHES at his rhy guitar. Hawk is sort of the brains of this operation, but knowing the others, that doesn't say much. LEX POUNDS a bass with earnest determination. Lanky with posture, Lex is already sporting worry lines. He takes  everything way-too-seriously. TRIP STRUMS lead guitar like he's hammering nails. All id Trip is slightly out of his mind. But, is it the chemical or just his chemistry. He always wears a knit cap. JAM, a sensitive kid (but no wuss), BASHES on his drums l a madman making the bass drum pulsate like a spastic hear The big drum bears the word "Mystery" painted on its skin with a lightning "S" just like the KISS logo. They bring the classic tune to a shrieking conclusion and thrust their hands over their heads in the KISS symbol.   Hawk screams into the mike at their imaginary audience.

Thank you, Cleveland! You're a great  crowd. But after three and a half  hours of kick-ass rock and seven  encores on top of that, I'm sorry to  say that this time we really gotta  get back to our hotel rooms and fuck  some groupies.
Behind him, Trip grabs Lex's bass and swings it by the ne at an amp pretending to bash it over and over again. Lex  quickly yanks it away from him.
What the fuck, Trip? That's my bass!
Jam emerges from behind the pile of drums smiling.
That was curly!
Just one more day of school to get  through, girls, before tomorrow  night... Live! (getting excited) COBO Hall! Detroit, Michigan! (like an announcer) You wanted the best!
You got the best! The hottest band  in the world... KISS!!
They all make that BREATH SOUND that mimics a screaming c Suddenly, headlights swing by in the window above them li a spotlight. Lex hops onto the unmade bed and looks out t cellar window.
A baby-shit green, Ford station wagon with fake wood side SCREECHES into the driveway. Mrs. Bruce gets out and STOM toward the house. Lex gasps at the sight.
Shit! It's Jam's mom!
Jam GULPS as if he's just shat out an whole can of Lincol logs.
My mom? Oh, no! What's she doing  here?

Lex quickly throws a KISS towel over a TV tray hiding a b cigarettes, overloaded ashtray. Trip kicks half-empty bee bottles under the bed. Hawk sprays Lysol frantically arou the room as Jam shovels gum into his mouth. KNOCK, KNOCK, KNOCK! Mrs. Bruce pounds on the cellar wind crouching to see in. She looks like a crazed, underlit ps
(muffled through glass) Jeremiah! Jeremiah Bruce! You get  out here this instant!
The boys looks up like innocent, wide-eyed angels. Jam wa
Oh, hi, mom.
(screams) NOW!
Jam quickly pockets his drumsticks and grabs his worn, de jacket off the pile of jackets on the floor, then runs  upstairs. The others follow.
The front door opens. Jam steps out to greet his mom with nervous smile. Hawk, Lex, and Trip stand at a safe distan in the foyer behind him.
What's up?
Mrs. Bruce grabs her son by the ear and holds up the KISS LOVE GUN record waving it in his face.
The devil's body count, that's what's  up! Don't you know what KISS stands  for? "Knights in Satan's Service!"

She hauls Jam across the lawn. Hawk, Lex, and Trip step o the porch looking on in sympathetic embarrassment. Mrs. B stuffs the record in the trash can then throws Jam in the front seat. SCREECH, the station wagon pulls away.
Jam has yet to do an overnight with  us.
I had a nightmare once that something  like this might happen. I hope he  doesn't get grounded again. If he  misses Peter Criss's drum solo, I  don't know if he'll be able to handle  it.
Lex, quit trying to always jinx  things. Don't worry, dudes. Nobody's  missing that concert tomorrow night.

The LOVE GUN album sitting in the trash can. CAMERA MOVES on the round label till it FILLS THE FRAME. The record be to spin like on a turntable as CAMERA DESCENDS INTO the l hole ENGULFING THE FRAME IN BLACK. This LEADS us INTO...

"ROCK 'N' ROLL ALL NITE" BLASTS the way it's supposed to  sound. The jammin' KISS classic is accompanied by a barra of QUICK CUTS depicting KISS mania. TV appearances. Conce footage. Magazine covers. Comic Books. Posters. Art work. KISS merchandise, dolls, lunch boxes, clothes, etc. We see the BAND do their thing in authentic CLIPS FROM RE SHOWS. GENE, PAUL, ACE, AND PETER SHOUTING IT OUT LOUD. The MONTAGE is a colorful, kick-ass kaleidoscope of the e KISS phenomena. CUT TO the BEAT of this seminal anthem. The FINAL IMAGE is the KISS "DESTROYER" POSTER.

The sun's early morning rays beam through the KISS "Destr poster taped onto a window shade. The phone RINGS. Jam bo upright, his profile blocking the poster. He has just awa under the only other decoration in his room: a crucifix. Still dressed in last night's clothes, a plain black tee- shirt and blue jeans, Jam leaps out of bed unwittingly  planting a foot in the handle of a Bullworker (a piece of exercise equipment comprised of a powerful spring with tw handles on either end) whose other handle is stuck under of the bed's legs. Jam runs to a phone on his dresser, drawing the Bullworke powerful springs out to maximum tension. No sooner does h pick up, when he is yanked to the floor and dragged acros it as if tied to the bumper of a speeding car. Despite th Bullworker pulling him back toward his bed, Jam does mana to get the phone to his ear.
Hello?
The phone's cord stretches taut causing its cradle to lea from the dresser and WHACK Jam on the head.
Hawk is on the phone as Lex and Trip scour every inch of cluttered room on their hands and knees searching frantic for something.
Jam, listen up.
Hawk?
Just listen up, man, cause we are in  a quandary.
Jam clutches the phone with his shoulder GRUNTING as he d battle with the Bullworker for possession of his foot.
Are you on the crapper with one of  those antenna phones? Sounds like  you're taking a dump the size of  Butte, Montana.
It's my Bullworker.
Anyway, listen up. They're gone!
What's gone?
The KISS tickets, you nimrod! They're  just fuckin' gone! Please tell me  you have'm!
(panicked) Gone!? Why would I have the KISS  tick...?
Just check whatever you were wearing  last night. Now!
Jam briefly scans his surroundings double-taking at the d jacket lying on the floor. He checks the pockets and sees four tickets labelled KISS - JUNE 7, 1978 - COBO HALL,  DETROIT.
Whew! Oh, God, Hawk... I got'm!   Somehow I musta taken Trip's jacket  by mistake!
Hawk SIGHS like a deathrow convict pardoned at the last  second.
(to others) He's got'm!
Lex and Trip collapse with relief.
Trip, he took your jacket by mistake.   You must be wearing Jam's.
Trip reaches in a breast pocket and pulls out Rosary bead Spooked, he drops them like they were a bug.
(into phone) Cool.
I'm really sorry about that, man.
Don't be a fembot. So, are you like  grounded because of last night, or  what?
Of course, but has that ever stopped  me before? Besides, my mom's going  to some church meeting and won't be  back till late. No sweat... See you  guys in school.
CLICK. DIAL TONE. Jam hangs up.
Lex buckles his belt with its huge KISS belt buckle.
Poor, Jam, man. Imagine having to  stash your KISS records inside Carly  Simon album covers. No question,  Mrs. Bruce is a psycho-bitch from  hell.
You're one to talk, Lex. Your mom's  a fuckin' dyke.
Trip pockets his wallet which is affixed to a long chain  attached to a side belt loop.
Trip, a female gynecologist does not  a lesbian make. And even if it did,  at least my mom didn't give birth to  me while she was on LSD.
Shrooms! And even if it was LSD, I  can still give my mom a kiss without  smelling the catch of the day.
Both you assholes, SHADDAP!
Lex and Trip shaddap.

Enough of the mom-bashing, all right?   Lex's mom is cool about us crashing  over here while she's out of town.  And if it weren't for Trip's mom, we  wouldn'ta smoked that fine Panama  Red last night. So leave the women  who gave you life out of it. They're  both cool.
Trip and Lex cease and desist the mom-bashing and continu getting ready for school. Suddenly, Lex pushes Trip angri
Trip, you fuckin' asshole.
What?
Lex points to a wet mess on the pillow.
You spilled my Sea Monkeys all over  the bed.

Jam gives the Bullworker one final yank. This time it com loose... not from his foot, but from under the bed. Its h lashes up SLAPPING him across the face. Ouch. Fully awake now, Jam throws on Trip's denim jacket. He st a drumstick into his left sock. We see "Mystery" written it. Just as he's about to stick the other one in his righ sock... Without a second of warning, or even a knock, Mrs. Bruce  suddenly ENTERS. Immediately Jam stands.
Jeremiah, what are you doing?
Uhh... nothing.

She turns to his closet, the door blocking her view of th KISS poster. Jam leaps to the window and yanks the "Destr shade. It shoots up, FLAPPING around its rod. He's done t before. Mrs. Bruce peeks at Jam from around his closet door. He  stretches in front of the window.
Ahh, sunshine.
You're going to be late if you don't  hurry up and change soon.
Change? What's wrong with what I got  on?

It's dirty laundry for one thing and  for another, you still haven't worn  the clothes I bought you. You're  skating on thin ice already, young  man, so I wouldn't push my luck. Now  get out of those rags.
But, mom!
Besides, those jeans are so tight I  can see your penis.
Jam reluctantly takes off the denim jacket as Mrs. Bruce  grabs the single drumstick from his hand and shakes it at him.
Someday you'll see the futility in  forging a musical career with those  idiots.
She turns and rummages through the closet.
(to himself) They're not idiots.

Now don't forget you're on the honor  system tonight. I'll be home a little  after one and if you've been partying  or playing that satanic KISS music...  well, need I remind you of the  consequences?
Grounded for the rest of the year?
You're a smart boy, Jeremiah. And so  handsome.
She pulls two Sears department store boxes from the close and lays them on the bed. Jam is visibly horrified. THIS IS YOUR MOTHER! / THE GIRL'S ROOM

The suburban high school is teeming with morning activity School buses pull up to the curb. KIDS arrive in droves a immediately find their cliques. The JOCKS and PRIMADONNAS make up the popular crowd. There's DISCO DUDES, FRESHMEN look like grade schoolers, and GEEKS. At the smoking section hang the BURNOUTS. Hawk, Trip, and Lex stand amid the other long-hairs.
School. What a fuckin' waste of time.
Two GIRLS with tons of make-up, hair so feathered it coul fly, and tight clothes, saunter by SNAPPING gum.
Will somebody please tell those chicks  disco is dead.
Stellas. I hate stellas almost as  much as I hate dogs.
Same species when you think about  it.
Their words say one thing, but their eyes say another. Th can't stop gawking at the chicks' asses. Girl #1 sneers b
Don't stare too long, you'll go blind.
The boys quickly cover.
(defensive) Yeah, right. She wishes. Look at  that big ass.
You know what they say about a big  ass... big shit.
They chuckle. Just then, Jam steps off a school bus in an unbelievably geeky outfit, white corduroy slacks, plaid s buttoned to the top, argyle socks and brown deck shoes.
Hey, that dork looks just like Jam.
Hawk and Lex look and laugh when they see him.
Shit, that dork is Jam.
(to Jam) YO, DOOFUS!
Jam gives them the finger.
Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam grab books from their lockers.   KISS stickers, photos, and rock magazine cut-outs line th insides. Jam's locker door is covered with Peter Criss on
So, Jam, who did your wardrobe, Tad  the preppie sailboat captain?
Hey, my mom had me over a barrel,  all right. After last night, I had  to let her dress me today. It's a  give and take relationship.
Yeah, she gives you shit and you  take it.
Okay, enough. Enough. Gimme the  tickets. I wanna hold onto them.
They're still at my house in Trip's  jacket.
They're what?
She was standing right over me when  I was changing for fuck's sake.
That's some sick shit right there.   Did she comb your ass hair for you  too?
If your mom so much as smells those  tickets, they're history, and we get  screwed outta seeing KISS for the  third year in a row, the third year!
Don't worry about it. They're  perfectly safe. We can pick them up  after school. My mom won't be home.  It's no problem.
All right. After school we double- time it to your house for the tix  before heading to the train station  for the 2:45 to Detroit Rock City.
Check.
The BELL RINGS.
As they say in the Tampon biz, see  you next period.
SLAM! They shut their lockers in unison.

The STUDY HALL TEACHER grades papers. On the wall a pictu of President Carter hangs next to Old Glory. The words "B Quiet" are written on the blackboard. Students study, read, doodle, sleep. Jam is at his desk  touching up the word "Mystery" on his drumstick. Next to sits BETH. Quirky, but cute, she stares longingly at him  wanting to say something, but not having the guts. Pleased with his work, Jam puts the drumsticks on the des and opens a Peter Criss album cover notebook depicting  countless doodles of the KISS logo, the Mystery logo, and renderings of Peter Criss. Beth SIGHS and opens her own notebook. Drawings of hearts fill the pages. In them is written "Beth + Jeremiah" and love Jeremiah." Then, one of Jam's drumsticks rolls off the desk and onto the floor. Beth quickly reaches down to grab it for him j as he bends to get it too. THUD, they bash heads.
Oof! (whispering) Sorry.
Rubbing her head, she smiles and hands him the drumstick.
No problem.
Thanks.

He stuffs his drumsticks in his socks pulling his pantleg down. Jam and Beth stare at each other. There's a mutual  crush, but both are apprehensive about making the first m Both want to speak, neither does. They awkwardly go back their notebooks. Mustering the nerve, Jam breaks the ice and whispers...
Beth?
Beth spins too quickly. Her pen flies out of her hand.
Yes?
BOINK! The pen hits Jam in the eye.
Ow!
Feeling awful, Beth moves in to help. The teacher looks u sternly.
Mr. Bruce, Miss Bumsteen, is there a  problem?
No. No problem.
Jam points to his eye.
Just a little pink eye. No reason to  panic.
Unamused, the teacher goes back to grading.
(whispering) Sorry.
(handing back pen) It's okay.
Beth resumes doodling feeling like an idiot. Jam does too Ah, teenage awkwardness. Finally, Beth musters up some  courage.
Jeremiah?
Yeah?
She hems and haw, then...
I wanted to tell you something...  I...
Suddenly, Beth is rudely interrupted by HIGH-PITCHED FEED coming from the P.A. The PRINCIPAL'S VOICE ECHOES over it
Jeremiah Bruce, come to the office  immediately...
Jam throws a startled glance to the speaker as the class  sings in unison.
Oooo, you're in troubaaaallll.
Your mother's here and would like to  see you right away...
More FEEDBACK as the mike on the other end changes hands.
Give me that microphone... Jeremiah,  you get your sorry self down to this  office, mister!
All the kids except for Beth burst into hysterical laught Mrs. Bruce's tirade continues over QUICK SHOTS of...
Hawk sits at his lab table burning an eraser with his Bun burner. His eyes widen with horror behind his goggles as other STUDENTS laugh till they hurt.
I found some things in the pockets  of your jacket while I was picking  up your disgusting laundry today...
Lex's eyes bug with terror. The basketball game is at a  standstill as everyone is crippled with laughter.
Cigarettes! Marijuana! Prophylactics!
Trip dozes at his desk as an out-of-date film about VD  sputters on. The room is deafening with laughter. Then, a if hit by a ton of bricks, Trip wakes up alarmed by the  familiar, shrilly voice.
And something much, much worse!
Holy shit, my jacket!
We see Jam, Hawk, Lex, and Trip agog in dread.
If you know what's good for you,  you'll get down here... NOW!
Jam slowly sinks in his chair under the profoundly humili weight of an ENTIRE SCHOOL'S ECHOED LAUGHTER.

Mrs. Bruce sits next to a stand-up ashtray in the high  school's waiting area. Scowling, she fans the KISS ticket out with one hand. Jam sits across from her, one leg jitt anxiously. They sit for an uncomfortably long time until... Mrs. Bru pulls a cigarette and lighter out of her purse.
I made an appointment with Father  Phillip McNulty at St. Bernard's.   We're to see him directly where he  will register you on the spot.
You mean, you're sending me to... b- b-boarding school?

What else can I do? Oh, records and  magazines and comic books are one  thing, but tickets? TICKETS? Jeremiah,  do you realize what this means? That  you're no longer content merely  hearing their awful songs or looking  at photos of their horrific faces!  Now you want to see the devil in the  flesh. You want to reach out and  touch pure evil... and in Detroit no  less!
She flicks the lighter, not yet lighting the cigarette.
Mom, three of those tickets don't  even belong to me. They're for the  guys.
Mrs. Bruce holds the tickets over the lighter's flame.
And if the "guys" have parents who  truly love them, they will elevate  me to sainthood for getting rid of  these blasted things.
Mrs. Bruce lights her smoke with the flaming tickets, the drops them in the ashtray where they burn for a cruel  eternity. Jam stares semi-catatonic through his mom's sou expression.
It's been a long time coming, son,  but you're finally going to get the  kind of discipline you deserve.
She stands and pulls him out the front entrance by his ar
Hawk, Trip, and Lex peek around it, their heads forming a totem pole. One-by-one they pull back.
They slump against the wall devastated.
I knew it! I knew this was gonna  happen! I had a bad feeling since  last night. Remember? We are so  totally fucked!
Waitaminit, dudes! I got it! Maybe  we can glue the tickets back together!
What are you, high?
Yeah.
For once Lex is right. It's over.  Things can't get any worse from here.
Suddenly, a caustic voice BLURTS from down the hall.
I hope you rodents have hall passes!
The boys whip their heads around to see a potbellied, yel toothed, security officer with long sideburns and slicked back hair at the far end of the hall, fists on his hips. Meet ELVIS.
Wanna bet.
Could that be three detentions I  smell?
Elvis laughs and breaks into a run barreling down on them like a maniac. Keys JANGLING furiously.
Second floor girls' john! Two minutes!  He'll never look there!
Check!
They take off in three different directions. Still laughi Elvis stops where the boys just were. Which one to follow He bolts after Hawk who has taken the nearest staircase.
Beth looks sadly out the window watching Mrs. Bruce push in the car. Beth puts her hand on the pane wanting to tou him.

Meanwhile, Elvis HUFFS and PUFFS up a flight of stairs  arriving at a set of swinging doors. He goes to push one but it swings out at him with a vengeance knocking him  backward. From behind it pops Hawk wielding a fire extinguisher. BL A hail of foam covers Elvis's face. Hawk shoves the  extinguisher into the man's arms and pushes Elvis backwar down the stairs. He topples ass-over-head till he hits th landing.
You're way out of your league, Elvis.
Elvis rises and shakes the CO2 off like a wet dog. Lookin up, he sees the door gently swinging in and out. No sign Hawk.
Trip kicks a bathroom stall violently.
Fuck! Shit!
Lex sits on the toilet in the stall.
Hey, take it easy, man. This is the  girls' crapper, remember?

Wake up, Lex! We just watched Jam's  mom torch our fuckin' KISS tickets!  Not REO Speedwagon! Not Journey! Not  the Bay City Rollers! KISS! If you  can think of a better reason to trash  a bathroom, I'd sure like to hear  it!
Trip, it's not the end of the world,  okay? Quit acting all squeezed out.
Trip grabs Lex by the collar, yanks him off the toilet an shoves him against the wall.
Oh, everything's hunky-dory now that  the shit hit the fan just like you  said it would, you snug sonofabitch!  You fuckin' jinxed us!
Smug, Trip! Not snug, smug.
Hawk bursts into the bathroom.
We're clear, dudes.
They run to exit. Hawk first. Suddenly, Hawk backs up aga into Trip and Lex as if a swarm of killer bees was out th
A skirt just came around the corner.

Hawk, Trip, and Lex run back and pile into the last stall All three stand on the toilet bracing their arms against walls for balance. A FOXY GIRL hurries into the stall next to theirs. We see the top halves of three heads peek over the stall's parti The three boys don't make a sound as they watch her sit d As she glances up, they recoil fast. They whisper super-q
That's Sherry VanHafton.
I've been in love with her since the  second grade.
Then, a SOUND OF TINKLING. They all throw their hands ove their mouths to stifle the giggles. Suddenly, POOT! She l out an ECHOED FART. The boys are awestruck.
Whoa... she just farted.
I have never heard a girl squeeze  cheese in my entire life.
Weird...
Pause.
Peeeyeewww! That stinks!

Just then, the SOUND OF CRACKING PORCELAIN, as the toilet they're standing on breaks into pieces with a SMASH. They topple over pulling the stall walls down with them exposi the foxy chick sitting on the can. Water GUSHES everywher as she screams bloody murder, getting doused ruining her  Farrah-do. They bolt out the door slipping and sliding across the to of toilet water. Lex turns and shrugs to the traumatized  girl.
Heh-heh, sorry.
He's gone.
Mrs. Bruce uses a finished cigarette to light another.
Someday you'll have a son just like  you, Jeremiah. A boy who lies through  his teeth, buys demonic records, and  smokes the dope just like you.
(numbly) If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve  him.
What?!
I said, I'm sorry!

If you truly are sorry, son, then  you better pray like you've never  prayed before. God willed me to find  those tickets because He wanted to  hear from you.  He knows you need  help and He wants you to ask Him for  it.
Mrs. Bruce's car turns off the road and drives through an imposing set of wrought iron gates. The sign reads: St.  Bernard's Veil of Tears. A School for Catholic Boys.
Jam looks at what lies ahead. His face becomes a mask of  pure terror. We hear a THUNDER CLAP as Jam puts his hands together and closes his eyes humbling himself. He whisper
Please, God, help.

The car winds up the path leading to a dark, Gothic edifi over which tumultuous storm clouds continuously hover. TH BELCHES and bolts of lightning shoot at the blackened  crucifixes along the structure. We hear a SCARY ORGAN the

Except for the tinkering NOISES that are heard as the STU work on their projects, there is silence in Electronics C The teacher, MR. JOHANSEN, sips from a coffee cup and rea a newspaper, his feet on the desk. The headline says: "Ma Suicide in Jonestown. Cyanide in the Kool-Aid." Above him a long banner reading: "Sorry, Absolutely no bathroom bre Hawk, Trip, and Lex sit before a half-built radio on a wo bench, sheer desperation etched on their faces. Lex solders two copper wires together. Hawk attaches a di Trip absently plays with a squeeze pump attached to a lon plastic tube. He blows air into his face repeatedly with
(re:squeeze pump/tube) Wonder if you could smoke shit out  of this?
Maybe some tunage'll chase those  blues away.
Hawk turns the radio on and a HIGH FREQUENCY WHINE pours  from its speaker. He adjusts the volume, then the tuner,  until a DJ's VOICE comes through crisp and clear.
...and this is Simple Simon on the  rock of Detroit, W.A.R.P., home of  the biggest KISS giveaway in the  history of the universe!
Detroit? DETROIT? Hawk, Trip, and Lex react like they've  just been hit by phasers on stun. God is intervening.

I got four, count 'em, four front  row tickets along with four backstage  passes to the concert tonight at  Cobo Hall and I'm giving them to the  106th caller who can tell me the  real names of each KISS band member!
HIGH FREQUENCY NOISES again, then the radio loses recepti Hawk exchanges an anxious glance with Trip and Lex.
Too bad we're stuck in electronics  or...
Never mind with the too bad shit. I  got a crazy plan, but only the  craziest among us can pull it off.

Mr. Johansen still sits with his feet up, reading. The ne page's headline reads: First Test Tube Baby Born. Trip runs up to Mr. J's desk, one hand behind his back, t other on his crotch. His face is drawn in an expression o sheer agony. Hawk and Lex watch anxiously in the backgrou
Mr. Verudi, get back to your bench.
Trip puts one leg over the other always keeping a hand be his back.
But I gotta take a piss like you  would not believe, Mr. Johansen!
Put a clothespin on it till the end  of class, Verudi. You know my rule.
But ever since my doctor put me on  salt pills, it's been like Niagara  Falls every half hour! Please, Mr.  J! Have mercy!
Suddenly, a wet stain grows across the crotch of Trip's p
Salt pills? Don't insult my  intelligence, Verudi...
Mr. J. stops when he sees the stain starting to spread.
Jeezis, I'm taking a leak in my pants!

We now see Trip is squeezing the pump from before. He hol it behind him feeding water into the tube running down th back of his pants. The stain travels fast, hitting Trip's knee in a nanoseco In a state of shock, Mr. J. slowly opens a long forgotten drawer on his desk, finding a cobweb and dust-covered pad bathroom passes. He tears one off and dust flies everywhe He holds the pass out to Trip like it was a cross he was  holding before an advancing vampire.
(hoarsely) Get the hell out of here, Verudi!  You disgust me!
Hawk and Lex observe that Trip has been successful, then a Three Stooges-style handshake, whispering "Curly!"

The SECRETARY sits at her desk in the reception area fili paperwork. She pauses when she hears RUNNING FOOTSTEPS. T charges past, a big, wet stain on his crotch. The secretary notices the pump and tube flopping from the back of his pants as Trip turns a corner.
