Me? Mug? That's nuts. I said, do you  know where I can take a piss.
Chongo and his two buds laugh. Then, without a second of  warning, Chongo belts Trip in the gut. Trip doubles over falls breathlessly to his knees.
Okay, pimple dick, you've got the  option of walking outside with us or  gettin' dragged out. Either way you're  comin' with us.
Trip catches his breath.
Please, sir, don't kick my ass! I'll  do anything to get out of a beating!
Say, Chongo, perhaps we could use  some extra cash for tasty snacks at  the KISS concert our weasly friend  won't be attending.
Chongo scratches his head.
How much cash do you figure?
Take five for a minute, Chongo. Let  me do the math.

The little kid taps his finger on his chin and the theme  from "JEOPARDY" begins. While the kid thinks, Trip looks  nervously up at Chongo and his buds. Chongo reaches into denim vest pocket and we hear a CRINKLING NOISE. He comes back up with two walnuts, putting them between his bicep forearm. Trip watches in horror as Chongo makes a muscle and the  walnuts are shelled between two walls of iron-hard flesh. CREEEAAAACK! Chongo eats the walnuts, shells and all.

The full-to-capacity parking lot is patrolled by a couple SECURITY GUARDS. Lex cautiously makes his way to the edge of the parking l and looks at the back side of Cobo Hall just beyond the c link fence that surrounds the lot. He crouches down and walks between two cars parked agains the fence, looking both ways. Seeing a guard's flashlight beam, he sits stock still until the beam sweeps past, the SIGHS eased.
(whispering to self) I can't believe I'm actually  entertaining the notion of sneaking  in. I oughta have my cranium examined.
Lex finds a vertical break in the chain link. He lays on back, slides through, then stands on the other side of th fence. He's at the edge of a weedy, littery field that al happens to be poorly lit.
Whoa. Danger Will Robinson.
Spooked, he lays down again intending to slide back throu when a flashlight beam hits his eyes.
Hey you! Get back in here!
Lex sees the guard standing about fifty feet away on the  other side of the fence. Panicking, he bolts deeper into field.
You're not getting far, kid!
Lex double-times it as we hear the guard yelling into his walkie-talkie.
We got one just ran into the field  from the north lot!

The field gets darker as Lex closes in on Cobo Hall's wel lit loading dock, where ROADIES empty the remaining bits KISS's monstrous set from an 18-wheeler. Other huge truck are parked nearby. There's a bustle of last minute activi

Lex scurries from giant speaker box to a stack of lights huge trunks, keeping well hidden. He dodges roadies and a being seen by OTHER GUARDS. He slithers along side the 18-wheeler and nears the loadi bay. Up ahead some auxiliary speakers, drum kits, and  scaffolding wait their turn to be carried into the buildi
There he is!
Lex spins. The security guard, flanked by two others, bar right for him.
Shit!
He dives rolls under the 18-wheeler. The three security g leap for the pavement and crawl under the semi after him.

head_text.subj: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE SEMI

text: The three guards scramble to their feet and grab a SCRAWN BODY. They spin him around roughly.
Alright, wiseguy, you are so outta  here!
They suddenly realize they've got the wrong man. It's a  roadie.
Hey, what the fuck?
The roadie holds up his all-access laminate angrily.
Keep your paws to yourself, ya dumb  fuckin' apes.
The security guards look around frantically for Lex as ot roadies join in to defend their comrade.
Where'd he go? You see him?

No one pays attention as a bass drum is carried past the  guards and up the loading dock ramp. They don't notice Le crammed inside contorted into a shape befitting a yoga ma Praying he won't be spotted, Lex holds his breath as he's carried into the building and disappears.

head_text.speaker/title: JAM IN A JAM / KISS THIS

text: Jam sits in the front pew, head buried in his hands as Mr Bruce and the priest talk on the alter. Beth moves quietly in the back, unseen and unheard. She l overwhelmed by the architecture, the detail on the staine glass windows, the icons carved into the columns that sup the extravagantly decorated ceiling. The priest catches a glimpse of Beth meandering in the ba
Uh, next mass isn't until tomorrow  morning, young lady. Run along now.

Beth smiles nervously and heads back toward the front doo passing a confessional booth. She throws a glance back at the priest and Mrs. Bruce who have returned to conferring their backs to her. She stealthily ducks into the booth.
Now it's been a while since my boy  had holy confession. Could you...?
(smiling) Consider it done.
Mrs. Bruce looks down at Jam and sees his drumsticks poki out of his socks. She immediately takes them out and stuf them into her jacket. Jam doesn't even move.
It's about time you gave up on that  stupid dream once and for all. No  son of mine is going to be a career  musician.
Jam is stung. Mrs. Bruce and the priest head back down th center aisle exiting through the gigantic front doors. Sh eyes Jam.
Thank you, Father. I'll be back for  him before you know it; after I take  care of some unfinished business.
Just knock loudly, sister.
He lets her out and locks the door, leaving the keys in t lock, and walks over to Jam.
Come along, son. Get into the booth.
He helps the despondent Jam up. They walk to the booth an Jam reluctantly gets inside.

Jam kneels on the board and a mere two feet behind him, B sits on a bench shrouded in darkness. Her posture is that someone with a crate of nitroglycerine on her lap. We hear the SHUFFLING noise of the priest getting into hi own compartment next door. A moment later the small, eye- level door SLIDES open. The priest's face is barely visib on the other side of the thick screen, but he's there.
Forgive me, Father, for I have sinned.  This is my first confession in...  well... a really long time.
Prepare to receive the Act of Penance.   How many sins have you committed  since your last confession?
Just one, Father, but boy was it a  doozy.
Beth leans forward slightly and listens to Jam's confessi

Hawk's at a bar stool gulping sloppily and woozily from a rocks glass. Four more empty rocks glasses sit in front o him. He stares at the sexy woman who smiles back, blowing him kisses from the other side of the bar. The EMCEE enters the stage.
(into microphone) Okay, ladies, hang onto your hormones.  Here comes our next amateur. Let's  have a big hand for Hawk!
The beginning of a rockin' KISS tune comes over the P.A. Dicky approaches Hawk.
You're up, Hawk.
Hawk wakes up fast. There's nothing more sobering than ha to undress in public.
Oh, Dicky, I c-c-can't...
You're not gonna chicken out on me  now, are you? We've got your KISS  song playing and everything.
I-I c-can't...

(leans in close) Look, people undress in public  because, A, they're exhibitionists,  B, they're nutcases, or C, they need  the money. I can tell you're not A,  and I hope to hell you're not B. So  my suggestion is, think about why  you're a C and let your body party,  shake your groove thing, boogie oogie  oogie till you just can't boogie no  more.
Hawk thinks about it, then downs the rest of his drink. H grimaces at it's taste, then opens his eyes with new reso
You're right, Dicky. I gotta do it  for KISS. Gotta put a bag over its  head and  (hiccup) Do it for KISS.

Hawk swivels his bar stool to the right and gets off,  forgetting to stand when his feet hit the floor. He proce to fall flat on his face. Dicky looks down concerned, but Hawk stands with a little difficulty and heads for the st The crowd of women parts down the middle for him and chec him out as he walks by. They seem to like what they see.  Hawk looks nervously at the carnivorous faces leering at package first, his ass after. What the hell is he doing? Hawk reluctantly climbs onto the stage and the gals start CLAPPING to the song. He faces them and starts gyrating h drunken hips at them, feeling no confidence whatsoever,  until... The CHEERS start to ECHO and the pulsing lights begin to  hurt his eyes. Hawk watches the world proceed to spin fas than the disco ball above his head. He stops gyrating and clutches his stomach. BELCHING. Uh- Hawk spots an almost-empty beer pitcher one of the CHEERI IN-SLOW-MOTION women holds above her head. He runs up to edge of the stage, grabs the pitcher, and PUKES. The cheering and music come to a grinding halt. You can h a pin drop as Hawk yacks his guts out into the beer pitch It goes on for an excruciatingly long time, then finally  stops. Hawk looks up at the hundreds of astonished eyes staring him. He wipes his mouth, then a look of ease washes over face.
Wow. I feel a hundred times better!
He hands the vomit-filled pitcher back to the shocked wom
Thanks lady.
He looks over at the emcee, who gazes at Hawk from the DJ booth.
Maestro? As you were.
The emcee stands perfectly still, jaw agape.
Come on, dude, we got a bunch of  frisky felines waiting for some  entertainment! The show must go on!

Hawk starts gyrating even though the music is still off. emcee shrugs, re-cuing the song. It starts again as Hawk  faces the crowd, dancing with new-found bravado. The women come out of their dumbstruck comas and reluctan start CLAPPING again. Hawk pulls off his jacket and twirls it over his head Rog Daltry style. Then he pulls it back down and tosses it in the crowd. The women actually fight over it. Encouraged, Hawk then peels off his KISS Army tee-shirt a hurls it at the women, who SQUEAL with delight. Sure, he be scrawny, but they don't mind. This lad's got personali Adrenaline pumping, confidence building, Hawk starts play the crowd of very responsive ladies. He unbuttons his jeans first. Then, leaving them on, he d an "air guitar" medley: Chuck Berry, ZZ Top, Angus Young  from AC/DC, and Elvis Costello in six easy steps. Hawk finishes off with a Pete Townshend windmill, shaking his ass at his audience in mid-strum, then licks his fing and touches one of his cheeks: "hot stuff" (he does this a manly way of course). Then Hawk pauses to adjust what looks to be his underwear bunching up in his crack. The women WHOO-HOO. He segues into a Mick Jagger rooster strut and the ladies ga-ga. He makes the sign of the horns with each hand and  wiggles a protruding tongue like Gene Simmons. The gals s in orgastic joy. Then, Hawk goes for the gold. Yes, he does the Fonzie dan The women are now overcome by sheer animal lust. Hawk's  whipped his audience into a frenzied pack of bitches in h Amanda smirks and sucks from her little drink straw  suggestively. At long last Hawk figures he has to give them what they w He puts his fingers to his fly, pauses, then unzips. His  Brittanias fall to his ankles, revealing a pair of bony l sticking down from some KISS boxer shorts. The ladies go  batty. Unfortunately Hawk has neglected a cardinal rule of disro Never pull your pants down without taking your shoes off  first. He tries to kick off his shoes. The left one goes  flying across the bar and THWACK, beans a MIDDLE-AGED WOM in the face. She flies backwards over a chair. Trying to kick the other shoe off, Hawk loses his balance and falls backwards, hitting his head on the edge of the  bar.
Trip looks at the little kid, Chongo, and the two buds in fear.
Two hundred bucks?
You heard me, nad breath. My time's  precious and I think that's a  reasonable price to pay for your  sorry life.
Look, I want to live, but I don't  know where the fuck I'm gonna find  two hundred bucks.
The little kid shakes his head in disgust.
Chongo? Take him outside and tear  his ass out through his mouth.
Chongo advances, muscles flexing.
Hold on! I know how I can get the  money! I just figured it out! Only  you might wanna wait outside.
The little kid and Chongo look at each other.
I don't trust him.
I think he's on the level. He's too  stupid to try anything sneaky anyway.  Look at him, he's a moron.
They look back at Trip.
You got fifteen minutes and not a  second longer. We have a concert to  go to. See you outside.
Trip nods sullenly as the kid, Chongo, and the two buds e Then he checks to make sure Stretch Armstrong is still wi him.
Lex is twisted like a pretzel as he's carted into the bow of Cobo Hall. He tries to keep calm, but it's not in his  nature.
(under his breath) Keep it together, Lex. Anything worth  fighting for is worth dying for.
ROADIES and TECHIES run in all directions as last minute  preparations are being attended to. Two roadies carry the base drum down a long ramp unaware  that Lex is hidden inside.
Boy, this one's heavy.
Suddenly, Roadie #2 snags his foot on a mess of cable and loses his balance, dropping the oversized drum. In an ins the drum goes rolling down the ramp quickly gaining speed
Shit!
The roadies bolt after the runaway drum. Other workers sc out of the way to avoid being hit by the speeding instrum
Lex spins like in a dryer on speed.
WHOOOOAAA!

More techies jump out of the way as the wayward drum head right for a closed set of double doors. The roadies are j about to grab it before impact, when... The door unexpectedly swings open. The FOXY GROUPIES on t other side scream at the sight of the careening drum head straight for them.
Close that door!
Too late. The groupies jump away as the drum flies throug the open door and down a flight of stairs.
The drum bounces down the zigzag stairway violently. Lex' GRUNTS of pain can be heard from inside.
The big drum hits the landing hard, tips over, then spins like a quarter getting faster before it stops.
They barrel down the stairs two at a time. Finally reachi the bottom, they grab the drum.
Peter's gonna kill us.

As they carry the drum back up the stairs, we see it is n empty. Once the roadies are gone, CAMERA TILTS UP to the  ceiling. There's Lex clutching exposed pipes for dear lif hanging upside down, praying the coast is clear. BETH'S CONFESSION / COMPENSATORY POSSIBILITIES
Jam is at the end of his confession. The priest is still  listening on the other side of the screen. Beth sits in t shadows behind Jam.
So, you see if it wasn't for me, me  and my friends would be at that KISS  concert right now... together.
That's it?
Yeah.

Well, this is a unique confession to  say the least, son. And not exactly  the most interesting one I've ever  heard either. You sure you don't  want to talk about... oh, carnal  knowledge with a neighborhood girl  or impure thoughts about the new  student teacher maybe... or how about  finding a box of magazines under  your dad's bed?
No.

Well then, I suggest you have a seat  on the bench behind you and think of  something a little juicier to confess  than losing KISS tickets. I realize  this is Detroit, but I personally  find, what that rock and roll band  is all about, to be boring as  Lucifer's kingdom. I'll return in a  little while.

The priest SLIDES the door shut again. Jam is all but shr in darkness, but can make out the time on his watch. It's getting late. He resignedly sits on the bench behind him. right on Beth's lap. Jam yells, but Beth throws her hand over his mouth. His e bulge. He can't believe what he's seeing. He climbs off B and sits next to her.
(whispering) Beth? I can't believe it.
Believe it.
Jam thinks for a beat. Something still isn't quite clicki
Are you waiting for confession? I  thought you were Jewish?
BETH can hardly speak. She gulps thinking of what to say.
I have a confession. Here it is.
Beth gives him the biggest, wettest, sloppiest kiss in  recorded history. She pulls away finally wiping her mouth
I didn't mean for that to be so...  intense. Forgive me.
I don't care. I wanna hear more.
She lunges at him again, kissing him for dear life. Her l leave his and begin to explore his chin, neck, ear.
I've loved you ever since I first  laid eyes on you, Jeremiah. I've  just always been too scared to show  it.
Beth, I can't believe you just said  that because that's exactly how I've  always felt about you... Call me  Jam. It's my band name.
You don't know how long I've been  waiting to hear that... Jam!
He kisses her neck. Unable to stop, they start undressing each other, both breathing heavy.
We've got to take this slow...
Right, slow...
Oh, screw it!
She tears his tee-shirt open with her teeth.
A really buff STRIPPER dressed as a construction worker i on stage with about ten others who stand in the backgroun The emcee's hand hovers above the stripper's head.
Okay, ladies, it's down to... Troy  the Human Jackhammer...
The women APPLAUD as we... FOLLOW the emcee's hand to Hawk who holds an ice pack on side of his head.
...and Mr. Massive Head Wound  Accompanied by an Upset Stomach-Hawk!
The women APPLAUD but not quite as loud.
No contest. The grand prize of seventy- five dollars goes to Troy the Human  Jackhammer!

The women cheer and a DISCO SONG starts as Troy does a re of his act. Hawk walks away from the stage with the rest the rejected strippers, looking the way he feels: pretty  damn stupid. He puts on his pants, trying to walk at the  same time and falls to his knees. A helpful hand grabs him under the arm and helps him up. It's Amanda looking lustier than ever.
Thanks, miss.
You're too kind. I'm Amanda.
Right, well, thanks for the drinks  and stuff, Amanda, but there's no  reason for me to stick around these  parts anymore.
Don't be so glum, Hawk. The night's  still young and filled with plenty  of compensatory possibilities.
Huh?
I'd be in a position to spend some  money on you if you'd get in a  position and spend some time on me.
Hawk GULPS.

Jam and Beth lay buck naked, tightly wrapped around each  other in the heat of passion on the confessional booth fl They kiss, sweat, and PANT heavily. Suddenly, the sliding door to the priest's booth opens. J and Beth freeze.
Where are you, son?
Uhh, tying my shoe.
Oh. So, have you thought of a colorful  confession yet?
Actually, yes. Last year I walked  out of a candy store with a Reggie  Bar I hadn't paid for, but went back  and apologized the next day.
Boooring. Think, boy, think!
We hear the door SLIDE shut again as Beth and Jam pick up where they left off.

Trip leafs through a KISS comic, not really paying attent to it. Directly behind him is the register and the CASHIE He starts hearing voices in his head. We see SUPERS of hi friends' faces hovering around him.
I can't believe you're even thinking  of committing a robbery, Trip. You  don't pass go and collect 200 dollars  for pulling stuff like this.

No shit, dude, is this really worth  it? Sure you get your ass kicked  nine ways to Sunday by that fucking  gorilla, but it's still a hundred  times better than getting it porked  for the next three to five.
Trip sends brief, agitated glances around the store meeti the cashier's eyes again. She smiles at him coyly as she  plays with her mood ring. He gives her the eye, then retu to his comic.
And what about that girl, Trip? She'll  never forget this night. Even if you  get away with it, she'll be scarred  for life. When are you gonna realize  sometimes being tough means being  tender.
(to the other voices) Alright, everybody, SHUT UP!

Trip snaps out of it. All the shoppers and cashier are  starring at him. He COUGHS loudly, clearing his throat to cover his outburst. The shoppers go back to shopping. A MAN WITH A LONG COAT enters the store, looks around, th takes a spot alongside Trip and opens a Mad Magazine.
(whispering to himself) Okay, bro. You gonna have to do this  sometime. Might as well be now.

Trip puts a hand in his pocket and takes one last look at Stretch Armstrong before stuffing the action figure back so it looks like he's got a gun. He takes three deep brea and discreetly pulls his knit cap down over his eyes,  revealing it actually as a semi-ski mask that covers the half of his face. Just then, the man with the coat puts the magazine back a pulls something over his own head. Trip whirls around pointing Stretch-in-his-pocket at the  cashier... Just as the man in the coat, now masked with a stocking,  pulls the biggest shotgun ever made from under his coat,  pointing it at the cashier as well. The cashier shrieks. does Trip.
Evening, honey. Y'know what I am,  what this is, and what you have to  do, so do it quick. (to shoppers, Trip  included) The rest of you kindly introduce  yourselves to the floor and kiss it  hello.
His thunder now stolen, Trip drops to the floor along wit everyone else. The air is very tense. The cashier starts  SOBBING, keeping her hands in the air.
(to cashier) Do or die, bitch! Next time I let  the barrels do the talking.
P-p-please, mister, I'm just a high  school kid...
Man with the coat COCKS the chamber and the cashier  immediately opens the register drawer and starts emptying it.

Fuck school, that's what I say! I  just went through the motions till I  was old enough to drop out and I'm  leaving here with at least two fifty  the easy way. Look where all that  studying's gonna get you tonight.  Robbed at gunpoint and possibly shot  in the fucking head... for minimum  wage!
The man with the coat's laughter ECHOES in Trip's head ti he just can't take it anymore.
She suddenly shoots a surprise glance over the man with t coat's shoulder. Seeing this, the man spins around. There's Trip behind hi
Alright, drop it or I'll kick your  ass!
Astounded by Trip's audacity, the man with the coat turns his shotgun point-blank at Trip.
Oh, yeah! You and what army?
(gulps) The KISS Army!

Your wildest fantasy of a rock show's backstage area come true. The place is packed with "beautiful" people. Scanti clad BABES everywhere. Slick, RECORD BIZ-TYPES. Lots of f Lots of booze. Lots of fun. It's backstage at a KISS conc come on! CAMERA TILTS UP above the partying hordes to find Lex shi along an exposed duct amid the pipes, sprinklers, and ven Looking straight down on everybody, Lex is in awe and  disbelief.
This is real. This is not a dream!  This is real! I've pierced the inner  circle!
He takes the opportunity to peer down some BIG BUSTED GIR cleavage. Then his eye spots something else. He GASPS. A  door. On it a star. Written on the star, the word, KISS.
Oh, God, they're in there!

A big-haired HIPSTER in mirrored sunglasses KNOCKS on the dressing room door. It opens, but Lex can't see inside. T hipster stands in the doorway talking to whoever is there Lex cranes his neck to see around the door jamb. Desperat for a glimpse of his idols, he leans out too far. Suddenly, the entire duct collapses. Breaking loose of th ceiling, Lex hurls to the floor clutching the duct. Backs goers leap for cover as SMASH... he hits the ground in a  shower of plaster and dust. The hipster protectively pulls the dressing room door shu as two SECURITY MEN jump in front of it. Instantly, huge, burly hands come down on Lex's shoulders Before he can react, a slew of OFFICERS have him off his  feet and carry him away, a stunned expression frozen to h face.

Lex is thrown into a heaping garbage dumpster by the scru of his neck. The security officers laugh and pat themselv on the back as they hurry back in. Lex peeks out the lid. The alley is dark and spooky. He j out of the trash and comes face to face with the biggest  GERMAN SHEPHERD that has ever lived. Its teeth are bared its black, wolf-like body is coiled, ready to spring.
Lex jumps backward hitting the dumpster. A GROWLING PITBU walks out from the shadows and joins the Shepherd.
(petrified) Dogs! Why did it have to be dogs!

Then, a GROWLING DOBERMAN with a spiked collar emerges fr the darkness on the other side of the alley, its solid,  muscular form making the brick building nearby look like  jello. Lex starts SLAPPING himself on the face.
Wake up, Lex! Wake up, man! This  part's gotta be a nightmare!
No luck. He stops, when several other DOGS emerge from th shadows and gather behind the first three. These new mutt immediately join in the GROWLING chorale. The Shepherd sn at Lex.
(to the heavens) God, if you ever get me outta this,  I swear I will never masturbate again!
The pack BARKS even louder.
(to heaven again) I REALLY MEAN IT THIS TIME!
Beth lays in Jam's arms on the floor. They might as well the only two people on the face of the earth. They whispe
So. Is it true that Gene Simmons had  a cow's tongue grafted onto his real  one? Y'know, to make it so long?
I dunno. I think he had the piece of  skin under his tongue removed so he  could stick it out farther. I'm not  too up on Gene trivia.
Your man is the drummer, Peter Criss,  right?
Peter Criss is my inspiration, man.   If I paid a hundred bucks for a KISS  show and all I saw was his solo, I'd  consider it... money... Hey, how'd  you know that?
I have all your notebook doodles  memorized, Jam... Here.
She opens her backpack and pulls out a package addressed Jam. The return address reads: Beth Bumsteen, Somewhere i Ann Arbor.
Ann Arbor?

My dad's company is relocating him.  We're moving. That's why I was acting  so freaky in school today. I thought  it was the last time I'd ever see  you. Anyway, open the box. I would  have given it to you this morning,  except... like I said, I was freaking  out.
Jam opens the box and his jaw drops. It's a black tee-shi with the "Mystery" logo printed in white on the chest. Ja holds it up. It's gigantic.

I pass by this really cool tee-shirt  shop on my way to school every day  and I know you wear those black tee- shirts all the time. You look like a  size thirty-five, but all the sizes  were in Roman numerals. So I got you  an XXXL. That's thirty-five, isn't  it?

Touched, Jam kisses her for a long time. He starts puttin on the shirt when suddenly they hear the SHUFFLING of the priest entering his booth. Jam grabs his clothes and sits back on the bench. Beth starts getting dressed at his fee
Okay, you better have something really  sinful for me this time, son. My  patience is worn to threads and your  mom will be here any minute.
(pulling up his pants) Alright, Father, here it is. About  two weeks ago I went to my cousin's  wedding and one of the bridesmaids  asked me if I wanted to take a bath.
No...
Beth is tying her shoes. Jam slips on his socks.
I was insulted, so I asked her if I  was wreaking some wicked b.o., right?   Then she said no, she wanted to take  a bath with me.
Oh, this is terrible... Please go  on.

Well, she was a very tempting siren,  Father. Built like you wouldn't  believe. So I gave into temptation  about a block away from the wedding  reception at this little motel that  charges by the hour.
Jam pauses.
Well? Continue! Continue!
Okay... when she peeled off that  gown, you'll never guess what she  was wearing underneath.
Was it a teddy?
Fully dressed, Beth crawls out of the confessional.
No. Much bet... I mean, much more  sinful than that.
A bustier?
Tell you what. You keep guessing and  I'll say something when you get it.
Splendid! I love a good game of Name  That Nightie.
Jam quietly sneaks out.
We can hear the priest's voice as Jam hurries to Beth. Th dash out the door.
Satin underwear? Crotchless panties?  Leopard skin bra? Fishnet leotard?  Leather G-string?
Still trapped by the GROWLING, BARKING pack of dogs, Lex  searches nervously through the garbage behind him.
Okay, okay, you're pissed off. I can  see this. So... Maybe what we need...  ah-ha.
Lex holds up a worn-out, old frisbee.
Play some frisbee, poochies?

The pack just glares and SNARLS. He tosses the frisbee ov the packs' heads, but the dogs don't even acknowledge it. They just keep BARKING and GROWLING. Meanwhile, an unnoticed dog at the rear of the pack, a ma Basset Hound, turns its flat head to see the frisbee land the ground behind him. His tail starts to wag.

(exasperated) Alright! I give up! I hearby and  forthwith defer my destiny to you  mutts. I may be an intelligent,  upright, walking, homo-fucking sapien,  but you fleabags are a force of  nature. So, I'm just gonna sit here  and wait for you to decide. If you  let me live, I thank you. If you  bite my head off, I'll die knowing I  did all I could. It's up to you.

Lex waits before the GROWLING, SNAPPING canines. Suddenly the Basset Hound runs up in front of the pack and drops t frisbee at Lex's feet. Lex looks down at the floppy, wrin dog, who wags its tail and PANTS furiously.
Well, how do you like that?

Lex starts to pet the hound, and one-by-one the rest of t dogs shut-up. Shocked, Lex picks the frisbee up again and throws it. This time the entire pack bolts after the Whammo product. Lex smiles, watching them fight for it in the air... in S MOTION... as the theme from "CHARIOTS OF FIRE" begins. The black Shepherd finally grabs the frisbee in its mouth and runs back toward Lex. It's soon joined by the rest of the pack. That's right about when Lex realizes they aren' going to stop.
Whoa! Whoa!

The dogs plow into Lex full-force knocking him into the  garbage. They surround him licking his face. Lex bursts i unstoppable laughter. Pulling himself up, he pets the dogs as they jump around wagging their tails and PANTING.
(baby talk) You sonsofbitches could tickle a guy  to death, y'know that? Sure you do...  Sure you do...

Lex stops. He hears TALKING coming from inside the window brick building on the other side of the alley. He steps i front of the pack and puts his fingers to his lips. They  obey, quieting instantly. He then tiptoes to a thin crack the brick wall. The dogs quietly follow. Lex puts his eye to the crack and peers in.

His mom's Volvo and a BMW are on adjacent hydraulic lifts inside a makeshift auto-mechanic shop. Two BEEFY JERKS with blow torches stand next to the cars. One has a bandage on his head and seems to be in pain.
So, I jump into the car, hot-wire it  in thirty seconds and start driving.  Then, suddenly I hear this scream.  The disco queen was asleep in the  back seat.
Beefy jerk #2 laughs.
You think it's funny? How would you  like to have a stiletto heel smacking  you in the temple when you're tryin'  to work?
Beefy jerk #2 laughs more. Beefy jerk #1 checks the time.
You about done splittin' a gut there?   We gotta get these parts to Toledo  by nine.
Then a familiar voice is heard coming from the back of th shop.
Then maybe you guys'll let me go,  huh?
Lex follows the voice and sees Christine handcuffed to a  radiator near the rear of the shop.
Come on, whadaya say? You scratch my  back, I scratch yours. You let me  go, and in return, I keep my big  mouth shut about your little operation  here. Mum, know what I mean?
You're lucky you're still alive,  wench. If you was a guy, we woulda  thought nothin' of sawing your head  off with a butter knife.
What are we gonna do with her anyway?
Beefy jerk #2 bares what's left of his yellow, crusty tee
I dunno, but she sure looks fun.
Beefy jerk #1 touches the bandage on his head.
Yeah, and payback's a bitch.
Christine GAGS at the thought.
Lex's eyeball bulges with terror.

DOLLY FROM the front end of a Jaguar XKE, Michigan vanity plate reading: AMANDA. TO its windshield, through which we see Hawk and Amanda  kissing in the front seat, clad only in their underwear.  Something like "ME AND MRS. JONES" plays on the radio. Wh they separate, Amanda takes out a flask and offers it to  Hawk.
Thanks.
He gulps some down and pulls the flask away COUGHING.
What the hell is that?
Gin.
Whoa. Some of this hard liquor's a  tad too manly for me. I'm a brewski  man myself.
Better ease up then, Hawk. Wouldn't  want to give you whiskey dick would  we?
Who's Whiskey Dick?
Amanda plants a stocking foot on Hawk's crotch and rubs.
Well. Obviously no one you have to  worry about... Woody.
My name's not Woody, it's Haw-haw...
Hawk's eyes cross as he lets out a DEEP, OBNOXIOUS GROAN.
...holy shit!
Amanda looks down at his crotch.
But you do know Premature Peter,  don't you? Shame, I just bought these  stockings.
Hawk has never been more embarrassed.
Well, Amanda, this has been quite a  night. So far you've seen me and my  dick throw up. (to the heavens) What's next? Projectile diarrhea? (beat, to Amanda) Man. What a stud, huh?

Believe it or not, you still have a  way to go before you start competing  with my soon-to-be-ex-husband... the  champion of lousy lovemaking. The  man who thinks he's the biggest and  the best... The man who thinks every  secretary, stewardess, and cocktail  waitress he fucks should lick his  feet for the honor. The man for whom  faking it was invented. Christ, if I  hadn't gotten pregnant with our son,  I would have never known I even had  sex with the prick.
She takes a healthy swig of gin, relishing its bitterness
You love him?
I just told you, he's a big, hairy...
No, I mean... you love your son?
More than anything in the world.
And he loves you back, doesn't he?
He's a little spoiled, but I know he  does.
Well, shame on him if he doesn't.
She pats his shoulder.
You're sweet.
Hawk stares out the windshield.

My mom died of a heart attack while  she was having me. Man, I wish I had  known her for even one day. If they  ever invent a time machine, that's  what I'm doing. Going back in time  to meet my mom. I'm gonna say, "Mrs.   Pitchford?... or Miss Williams,  depending on when I show up. You  don't know me, but I'm your kid from  the future. Just wanted to thank you  for the blue eyes, pug nose and for  tying the knot with a guy who didn't  mind diaper detail... Oh, and, uh...  cut down on the red meat, will ya?"
Amanda caresses Hawk's cheek. He turns with her hand and  kisses it. He takes her arm and begins kissing his way up her neck, her cheek, her mouth...
It's a stand-off. Prone customers look up at Trip and the man with the long coat circling each other like sharks. T helpless cashier lets out fearful sobs.
Gimme your gun, boy!
No, you gimme your gun, boy!
Don't tempt me, I'll shoot!
Not if I shoot first!
I don't even think you have a gun!
Neither do I!
The man with the coat puts his shotgun against Trip's hea
Now, for the last time, take the  piece out and lay back down or your  mom's gonna need the White Tornado  to get the brains outta your ski  cap.

Trip GULPS. The jig's up. He slowly pulls out Stretch  Armstrong, and the man with the coat glances down and sta to laugh very loud. So loud, he throws his head back. When he recovers, Trip's got Stretch aimed at his head an pulled back to maximum tension.
Smile, you sonofa...

Trip lets go. WZZMACK! The man gets it right in the face falls backward onto the Hostess display, toppling a whole bunch of Ho-Ho's, Ding-Dong's, Twinkies, and Suzy-O's to ground. Trip runs up and grabs the shotgun away as the man with t coat lifts his head briefly, then passes out. Trip turns around and the cashier SLAMS into him, nearly  knocking him over. She throws her arms around him letting out relieved SOBS. Behind her all the customers rise from the floor CLAPPING. Trip did it. He saved the fucking sto The cashier looks into Trip's masked eyes.
Thank you! Thank you!... Who are  you?
(with confidence) Call me... Dr. Love!

She plants a thousand mega-watt kiss on his lips and we Z IN on her mood ring changing color from gray to fire engi red. Trip's eyes widen just before... KABOOM... The shotgun he holding goes off, blowing a hole in the ceiling. The recoil from the blast jolts Trip and the cashier apar We now see Trip's face is smeared with bright, red lipsti A huge chunk of ceiling falls onto his head but he doesn' move. The kiss hit him harder. I'M HERE FOR THE GIRL AND THE CAR
BZZZZZ! Christine and the beefy jerks watch the brown, '7 Volvo, Ohio plates: OB-GYN, ascend on a hydraulic lift. Behind them sits the BMW skeleton. These boys work fast.
You guys better kill me before you  do what you're thinking of doing.  Cause when I'm mad enough, I can  bite down very hard.
The beefy jerks laughs.
Sweet Polly Purebred's got some spunk,  huh?
I'll give her some spunk alright.
They put their blow torches down and turn to her.
We stripped that Beemer in fifteen  minutes. Bet we can strip her in  fifteen seconds.
They giggle maniacally and lumber toward Christine. Their shadows growing larger and larger across her.

(mile a minute) Now wait a minute, guys! Two against  one ain't fair. Lemme go back and  get my friend Barbara. You'd love  her. Tits the size of your head.  You'll feel like a little baby sucking  on 'em. I swear, I'll bring her right  back. It'll be a four-way... You  guys like disco? I teach disco dancing  at my church. You guys look like you  got rhythm in your blood. Come on,  free lessons if you let me go.
I know a dance we can do. The  horizontal hustle.
They both laugh. Just as they're about to grab her... Suddenly, the garage door behind them SLIDES UP revealing darkness. Christine and the beefy jerks look out anxiousl
Who's there?
Silence except for CRICKETS. Then... from out of the dark emerges a figure... Lex. Christine's eyes brighten like a bulb.
I'm here for the girl and the car.  You can try to stop me, but I must  warn you, it may be hazardous to  your health.
The beefy jerks laugh at this little punk. They start tow him, one with a tire iron, the other a big monkey wrench.
Too bad. He was such a young idiot.
Ehhh. He was a stupid boy. He deserved  to die.

Lex lets out a quick HIGH-PITCHED WHISTLE. The pack of BA dogs led by the Shepherd, the Pit Bull, the Doberman, and the Basset Hound, step from the darkness and flank Lex,  GROWLING and SNARLING at the beefy jerks.
Listen to them. Children of the night.  What music they make... Hounds of  hell? Say hello to dinner!

The beefy jerks drop their tools on their feet and yelp i pain. The pack takes this as a threat and charge the beef jerks, who bolt for a glass-partitioned office. The dogs  SCRATCH and BARK at the window ferociously. Lex smiles at Christine. She smiles back. He presses the  "down" button on the lift and the Volvo descends. Lex yel to the beefy jerks through the glass.
One foot out of that office and your  asses are Alpo!
Lex unlocks Christine. She leaps into his arms.
Wow! Thank you! You're cooler than  the Fonz.
She gives him a lingering kiss. Lex leans back, gives the double thumbs-up, and says...
Aaaayyyyy!
Lex takes her hand and they walk over to the Volvo. Lex l her in then rounds the car to the driver's side.
Hey, what about the dogs?
You got a phone in there?
They nod. Lex drips a dry smile onto them.
Call the cops.
The beefy jerks watch in disbelief as the Volvo SCREECHES out of the chop shop. 2 GODDBYES, A PUNCH IN THE GUT AND A DRUMSTICK
Beth's parents wait in the running car as Jam and Beth sh a heartfelt good-bye outside the back door.
Ann Arbor isn't... that far from  Cleveland, right?
Nah. Once I get my own wheels, I  could come up all the time.
That'd be great. Hey, maybe someday  your band'll play there. It's a  college town, you know?
Jam takes her hands.
I feel like such an idiot. Why didn't  I just say something a year and a  half ago? Man, think of how much  time we wasted.
Let's not think about the past. Let's  just think about from today on. I'll  never forget you, Jam.
Tell me about it. Church will never  be the same again.
They stare at each other for a really long time. Then, ki BEEP. BEEP. Dad looks back out the window and CLEARS HIS  THROAT LOUDLY.
(flustered) Coming dad. (to Jam) I'll call you. Soon as we get a phone.  Bye.
Bye.
She gets in the car. They both wave as the Impala turns a corner out of sight. Jam is left alone still waving long  after she's gone.
Amanda and Hawk are half-dressed post-coitus. She looks i her purse.
Amanda, as ironic as this is gonna  sound, I can't take any money for...  I'm no Midnight Cowboy, y'know. It  would only cheapen the whole deal  for me.
I'm not paying you for the lovemaking,  Hawk. I just want you to have whatever  you needed the money for when you  took me up on my offer.
She forces the money into his palm.
...Thanks.
They kiss.
You're a good man, Hawk. Thank you.
The cashier, shoppers, and a gathering CROWD watch two co load the dazed man with the coat into a cruiser.
(to cashier) You wouldn't happen to know where we  could find this... Dr. Love, would  you?
It's company policy to hand over a  cash reward of a hundred and fifty  dollars to anyone who stops a robbery.  I gave him the money and he took  off.
The cops shrug and get into the cruiser.
Okay, well, thanks anyway. And let  us know if you happen to see him  again. We'd like to ask him some  questions.
The cruiser takes off and the cashier stares at her mood  ring. It throbs red like a beating heart.
(sighing to herself) If I see Dr. Love any time soon,  you're gonna have to wait till I'm  done with him first.

head_text.subj: CAMERA TRACKS BACK QUICKLY AND SWINGS JUST AROUND THE COR

text: We find Trip counting his money out to the little kid, Ch and their two buds.
...hundred forty, hundred fifty.   That's all I got.
The little kid puts the money in his pocket.
Tsk. Tsk. Tsk. I really wanted things  to work out for you, my weasly, dim- witted friend. You got spunk. (to Chongo) Chongo, give him a fifty dollar  wallop.
Chongo reels back and...
Oh, no... Please, look.  I...

THWAM! Right in Trip's face. Trip flies off his feet into the Smiley Mart brick wall with a THUD. A bag of weed dro from his jacket, then some uppers, a few sheets of acid, finally a can of beer rolls out.
Hey, the jerkoff's got drugs.
Consider it a bonus, Chongo.

Chongo laughs like an ejaculating gorilla as he and his t buds scoop it all up. The little kid, Chongo, and the bud leave Trip lying in a puddle of his own nose blood. He pulls out Stretch Armstrong and looks at him fondly.
(misty eyed) At least I still got you, Stretch.
Trip looks up. The six year olds who he stole it from sta close by having watched the whole humiliating exchange.  Licked, Trip tosses the doll to them. They both dash away with it, giggling.
Christine sits in an idling taxi taking money from Lex, w stands outside the window.
This oughta be enough to get you to  Disco Inferno, Christine.
Come with. It's not too late for you  to catch the fever.
No can do. But I made a promise to  get you to that disco, and we KISS  maniacs are men of our word.  Besides... you're pretty cool... for  a stella, I mean.
Christine takes his hand and writes something on his palm lipstick.
Here's my number. Tell me how cool I  am over the phone sometime. Okay?
She gives Lex a kiss then pushes him away.
(to CABBIE) Disco Inferno, on the double.
The taxi SCREECHES away as Lex smiles and gets back into Volvo.

Jam approaches the stadium, passing the MATMOKS, walking  straight up to Mrs. Bruce. Her back is to him. He taps he on the shoulder. She turns. Her jaw drops. It escaped aga And what an ugly tee-shirt.
I'm gonna ask you nicely first. Mom,  can I have my drumsticks back?
Taken aback by his confidence, Mrs. Bruce grabs his ear a tries to pull him away. He won't budge.
Again, can I have my drumsticks?
A BUNCH OF IDIOTS walk by with big transistor radios. One them holds a Mr. Microphone and heckles the MATMOKS.
Hey, I'm on the radio! Hi, good- lookin'. We'll be back to pick you  up later!
Mrs. Bruce yells at Jam through her bullhorn.
Drumsticks are the least of your  worries, young man. You are in a  world of...
Jam yanks the Mr. Microphone from the lead idiot and scre at his mother, his voice amplified on the transistors.  Everyone stares.
I know, mom, I've been in trouble  for about twelve hours now!  Hellooooo!?
The other MATMOKS turn to look as Jam climbs onto a trash receptacle and shouts down at his mother, his face slowly turning purple.

I'm gonna be spending the next two  years of my life at St. Bernard's  Boarding School, remember?! I'm gonna  be outta your hair till I'm a legal  adult, remember?! That way, all you  have to do is go to church, light a  candle, pray to a little statue for  me, and voila! All is forgiven and  forgotten, right mom?!! Then, you  can spend your days in guilt-free  pursuit of more constructive  activities like telling everybody  else how screwed up their lives are!  That way you no longer need the  patience and understanding required  to communicate on some normal level  with your own child!!! And that way  you don't even have to think about  how tough it was for you when you  were growing up, and it's a good  thing too. Cause if you did, you'd  realize what a LOUSY, GODDAMN, SHITTY- ASS, PARENT YOU ARE!!!
The crowd of KISS fans APPLAUD Jam's rant. Mrs. Bruce is  utterly winded from the assault.
(timidly) Jeremiah... what's gotten into you?
(into Mr. Microphone) I just lost my virginity in a  confessional booth! Lord have mercy!!
The crowd cheers. Jam jumps down and hands the Mr. Microp back to the lead idiot. He turns to his mom.
For the last time, mom. Let me have  my fucking drumsticks. Please.
Mrs. Bruce reaches into the trash, finds the drumsticks a hands them to him. He spins them like pistols, then stuff them into his socks and walks away.
Hawk runs to the scalper across the street who's selling ticket to another KISS fan.
Whoa! Whoa! WHOA! That better not be  the last ticket! I hope you have  another one for me!

The scalper sees Hawk and bolts down the street disappear around a corner. Hawk stops. He's lost him. Hawk sulks to the now-familiar intersection where all fou landmarks meet. He takes one more look up the block at Co Hall. Nearly all the KISS fans are inside. The streets ar almost deserted.
Fuck me!

He sees someone out of the corner of his eye across the  street. It's Jam. Lex approaches the other corner. Trip c up to the forth corner. They all stop when they see each  other. Each standing on his own corner. They're all pisse They meet in the middle of the street as last minute CONC GOERS hurry by.
Any luck?
Plenty, but it was all bad.
I found the Volvo.
Tickets?
They all shake no.
Well, dudes, the only way we're gonna  see KISS this tour is by some fuckin'  miracle.
Suddenly, a commotion up the street. A SURLY MOM yanks fo 12 YEAR OLD BRATS dressed like KISS by the scruffs of the necks. She's furious, they're CRYING.

How dare you sneak out of the house  like that! You had me worried to  death! Don't you know this is Detroit!  And for a degenerate band like KISS!  They're sick, sick, sick and oughta  be in jail with their vile antics!
She throws a wad of paper to the pavement as they pass ou four heroes. The dudes watch her pull the brats away.
Just wait until your father gets  ahold of you!
Jam, Hawk, Lex, and Trip turn and look at the crumpled wa at their feet. It's an envelope. An ANGELIC SPOTLIGHT FRO ABOVE highlights it.
No... You don't think...?
Nah. Couldn't be.

They all shake their heads in unison resolved that it isn Then, unable to control themselves, they dive for the  envelope. Jam tears it open. His trembling hand reaches i All their eyes focus like lasers on what's inside. Jam pulls out four KISS tickets. Their jaws drop. Their e bug.
It's a miracle! A miracle!
The boys are practically moved to tears. It's Divine  Intervention at its finest. Suddenly, a greasy hand juts out of nowhere and grabs the tickets. The boys look up shocked. They can't believe it.
ELVIS?!!
Yes, Elvis. Fire in his eyes. Mania on his mind. And tick in his hand.
(laughing hysterically) Whose laughing now?! Whose laughing  now, ya little shits?! I told ya...  Over my dead body! Ha-HA-HAAA!
(arms outstretched) Take it easy, Elvis. Don't do anything  crazy. Just give me the tickets before  someone gets hurt.
Hey, wait a minute! This ain't school  property! He's not the boss of us  here!
(crazed) That's right. This ain't school.  It's not about school anymore. Now  it's personal.
Come on, Elvis. We was only kiddin'.  It's all in good fun. We run, you  chase. Cat and mouse. You know.
Boys, this time... I win!

Elvis stuffs all four tickets in his mouth and chews craz In seconds, GULP. Elvis explodes into unhinged laughter a he runs away zigzagged down the street. Our boys are left dumbstruck and speechless. After a real long pause...
Well... I still got my idea if anybody  will let me speak.
(beaten) Go ahead, Jam.
We all beat each other up, then,  once we're nice and bruised, we run  over to the ticket takers and say we  got mugged and our tickets were  stolen. They gotta let us in then.

They stand and think for a moment. Hawk's mouth curls int devilish grin. Then, he lets out a gigantic "AIEEE!!! and slugs Jam. The four boys brutally pummel one another in the middle of th intersection. Punching. Kicking. Headbutting.
Two TICKET TAKERS are letting the last KISS fans in. They about to close the doors when our four bloodied and bruis heroes come running up.
Dude, you gotta let us in! Four  muggers just stole our tickets!
(sceptical) You expect us to believe that?
Look at us!
Trip points into the crowd of fans inside the auditorium  foyer.
It was those assholes! They even  stole my wallet!

The ticket takers turn to see the little kid, Chongo, and their two buds just going in. The ticket takers signal tw security guards who proceed to stop the four stunned kids and confiscate their tickets. They find all the stolen do and Trip's wallet.
Inside that you'll find my KISS Army  picture I.D. and a hundred fifty  bucks cash.
The security guards see he's right and break out the cuff
(to little kid) Tsk. Tsk. Tsk. I was really hoping  things would work out for you, my  weasly, midget friend. You got spunk.
The little kid for once is speechless. Then the ticket taker extends his arm in SLOW MOTION into COBO Hall as if to say "Entrez Vous." The four friends pa
This is it!
They take a few slow steps almost as if they don't believ it, then run like the wind into the auditorium.

The lights are out. The lighters have been lit. The CROWD ROAR is deafening. Jam, Hawk, Trip, and Lex plow their way through the thron and head straight for the front row just as Simple Simon  takes the stage.
You wanted the best! And you got the  best! The hottest band in the world...  KISS!!!

Simple Simon runs from the stage just as the opening chor to DETROIT ROCK CITY BEGIN. On the beat, BOOM, FIREWORKS shoot from the floor alighti the place. KISS takes the stage descending on hydraulic  elevators.

head_text.subj: ON JAM, HAWK, TRIP, AND LEX

text: They're seeing God! The show is spectacular. The costumes. The make-up. The  blitzkrieg of pyrotechnics. The flashing KISS sign. Ace's smoking guitar. Gene's spewing fire. Paul's rockin' vocal Peter's kick-ass beat. Then, something really weird happens. The crowd behind the boys heaves forward. Jam is pushed l a twig in a flood and over the shoulders of those in fron of him. Purely by accident, he is thrown onto the stage  landing on his stomach between Paul and Gene. Just before Peter's drum solo is about to start. Gene, Paul, and Ace silence their instruments. Peter thro his drumstick into the air intending to catch it when it  comes down. But the sight of Jam landing on the stage  distracts him. All is mute as Peter misses the drumstick. It hits the ou edge of one of the drums. Thinking fast, Jam grabs one of his drumsticks out of his sock and tosses it to Peter. It tumbles through the air i SLOW MOTION with a LOW, WHOOPING, HELICOPTER SOUND. We se the word "Mystery" clearly as it twirls. Instantly, it's caught in Peter Criss's hand and he bring it down on his drum not missing a beat. The song resumes  with all its fury as Peter's drum kit ascends on a hydrau platform. Jam scrambles from the stage and leaps back into the audi barely missing the claws of some security guards. The four friends pound on each other with unbridled, teen exuberance. Will it ever get any better than this? FREEZE FRAME.
